meanings.definition: Aligning or positioning in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: She was orienting the map towards the north.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide was orienting the group towards the famous landmark.
meanings.sent3: The confused cat was orienting itself towards the sound of a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her instincts were like a compass, always orienting her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon was orienting ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: Providing information or guidance to someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was orienting the students on how to complete the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The mentor was orienting the new employee on company policies.
meanings.sent3: The talking robot was orienting the lost travelers towards the nearest town.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a map, always orienting her towards the right decisions.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky were orienting the travelers on their journey.

meanings.definition: Adjusting to a new environment or situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt disoriented in the unfamiliar surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The students were slowly orienting themselves to the new school schedule.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked comically orienting in the tropical setting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a compass, quickly orienting to the changes around her.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon's color-changing ability was orienting to its surroundings.
